Package com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.builtin.input

Class UISpinner<T>

java.lang.Object
com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.UIComponent
com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.UIInteractableComponent
com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.UIFocusableComponent
com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.builtin.input.UISpinner<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of value this spinner produces
public class UISpinner<T> extends UIFocusableComponent
A UISpinner is a combination of a UITextField and two UIButtons that allow users to select a scalar value. Spinners can have minimum and maximum values that prevent users from exceeding preset boundary values (e.g., keeping values positive). They can also have default values that determine what value the spinner has before any user input.

The handler passed to the spinner defines how the spinner treats the values it operates on, which means that custom types can be supported by writing a SpinnerHandler for the type.

In addition to displaying their current value, spinners can be configured to display a "unit" string that indicates the units of the value the spinner is displaying (e.g., if a quantity represents a number of seconds, the units string could be set to "seconds" to indicate that).

  • Constructor Details

    • UISpinner

      public UISpinner(SpinnerHandler<T> handler, OnChangeListener<T> onValueChangeListener)
      Creates a new UISpinner that allows users to select values either using a text field or using increment and decrement buttons. The handler passed to this constructor determines how the spinner handles the type it is assigned. The listener passed to this constructor is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      For this constructor, the handler also determines the default value, minimum value, and maximum value for the spinner.

      Parameters:
      handler - the SpinnerHandler that determines how values are handled by this spinner
      onValueChangeListener - the OnChangeListener that should be called when the value of the spinner changes

    • UISpinner

      public UISpinner(SpinnerHandler<T> handler, T defaultValue, OnChangeListener<T> onValueChangeListener)
      Creates a new UISpinner that allows users to select values either using a text field or using increment and decrement buttons. The handler passed to this constructor determines how the spinner handles the type it is assigned. The listener passed to this constructor is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      For this constructor, the default value is provided, but the handler provides the minimum and maximum values for the spinner.

      Parameters:
      handler - the SpinnerHandler that determines how values are handled by this spinner
      defaultValue - the default value of the spinner before user input
      onValueChangeListener - the OnChangeListener that should be called when the value of the spinner changes

    • UISpinner

      public UISpinner(SpinnerHandler<T> handler, T minimumValue, T maximumValue, OnChangeListener<T> onValueChangeListener)
      Creates a new UISpinner that allows users to select values either using a text field or using increment and decrement buttons. The handler passed to this constructor determines how the spinner handles the type it is assigned. The listener passed to this constructor is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      For this constructor, the minimum and maximum values are provided, but the handler provides default value for the spinner.

      Parameters:
      handler - the SpinnerHandler that determines how values are handled by this spinner
      minimumValue - the minimum value allowed by the spinner
      maximumValue - the maximum value allowed by the spinner
      onValueChangeListener - the OnChangeListener that should be called when the value of the spinner changes

    • UISpinner

      public UISpinner(SpinnerHandler<T> handler, T minimumValue, T maximumValue, T defaultValue, OnChangeListener<T> onValueChangeListener)
      Creates a new UISpinner that allows users to select values either using a text field or using increment and decrement buttons. The handler passed to this constructor determines how the spinner handles the type it is assigned. The listener passed to this constructor is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      For this constructor, the default value, minimum value, and maximum value are all provided.

      Parameters:
      handler - the SpinnerHandler that determines how values are handled by this spinner
      minimumValue - the minimum value allowed by the spinner
      maximumValue - the maximum value allowed by the spinner
      defaultValue - the default value of the spinner before user input
      onValueChangeListener - the OnChangeListener that should be called when the value of the spinner changes

    • UISpinner

      public UISpinner(SpinnerHandler<T> handler, String unitsString, OnChangeListener<T> onValueChangeListener)
      Creates a new UISpinner that allows users to select values either using a text field or using increment and decrement buttons. The handler passed to this constructor determines how the spinner handles the type it is assigned. The listener passed to this constructor is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      For this constructor, the handler also determines the default value, minimum value, and maximum value for the spinner. The unit string, which is displayed on the text field, is provided.

      Parameters:
      handler - the SpinnerHandler that determines how values are handled by this spinner
      unitsString - the String that represents the unit of the value of the spinner
      onValueChangeListener - the OnChangeListener that should be called when the value of the spinner changes

    • UISpinner

      public UISpinner(SpinnerHandler<T> handler, String unitsString, T defaultValue, OnChangeListener<T> onValueChangeListener)
      Creates a new UISpinner that allows users to select values either using a text field or using increment and decrement buttons. The handler passed to this constructor determines how the spinner handles the type it is assigned. The listener passed to this constructor is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      For this constructor, the default value is provided, but the handler provides the minimum and maximum values for the spinner. The unit string, which is displayed on the text field, is provided.

      Parameters:
      handler - the SpinnerHandler that determines how values are handled by this spinner
      unitsString - the String that represents the unit of the value of the spinner
      defaultValue - the default value of the spinner before user input
      onValueChangeListener - the OnChangeListener that should be called when the value of the spinner changes

      Creates a new UISpinner that allows users to select values either using a text field or using increment and decrement buttons. The handler passed to this constructor determines how the spinner handles the type it is assigned. The listener passed to this constructor is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      For this constructor, the minimum and maximum values are provided, but the handler provides default value for the spinner. The unit string, which is displayed on the text field, is provided.

      Parameters:

      unitsString - the String that represents the unit of the value of the spinner
      minimumValue - the minimum value allowed by the spinner

    • UISpinner

      public UISpinner(SpinnerHandler<T> handler, String unitsString, T minimumValue, T maximumValue, T defaultValue, OnChangeListener<T> onValueChangeListener)
      Creates a new UISpinner that allows users to select values either using a text field or using increment and decrement buttons. The handler passed to this constructor determines how the spinner handles the type it is assigned. The listener passed to this constructor is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      For this constructor, the default value, minimum value, and maximum value are all provided. The unit string, which is displayed on the text field, is provided.

      Parameters:
      handler - the SpinnerHandler that determines how values are handled by this spinner
      unitsString - the String that represents the unit of the value of the spinner
      minimumValue - the minimum value allowed by the spinner
      maximumValue - the maximum value allowed by the spinner
      defaultValue - the default value of the spinner before user input
      onValueChangeListener - the OnChangeListener that should be called when the value of the spinner changes

  • Method Details

    • getMinimumValue

      public T getMinimumValue()
      Gets the minimum value allowed by this spinner. Any value below this value as determined by SpinnerHandler.compare(Object, Object) will be rejected in the text field, and the decrement button will be unable to lower a value beyond this point.

      A null value returned from this method indicates the spinner does not have a minimum value set.

      Returns:
      The minimum value allowed by this spinner, or null if no minimum is set

    • setMinimumValue

      public void setMinimumValue(T minimumValue)
      Sets the minimum value allowed by this spinner. Any value below this value as determined by SpinnerHandler.compare(Object, Object) will be rejected in the text field, and the decrement button will be unable to lower a value beyond this point.

      Passing a null value to this method will remove the minimum value from the spinner.

      Parameters:
      minimumValue - the minimum value allowed by this spinner, or null for no minimum

    • getMaximumValue

      public T getMaximumValue()
      Gets the maximum value allowed by this spinner. Any value above this value as determined by SpinnerHandler.compare(Object, Object) will be rejected in the text field, and the increment button will be unable to raise a value beyond this point.

      A null value returned from this method indicates the spinner does not have a maximum value set.

      Returns:
      The maximum value allowed by this spinner, or null if no maximum is set

    • setMaximumValue

      public void setMaximumValue(T maximumValue)
      Sets the maximum value allowed by this spinner. Any value above this value as determined by SpinnerHandler.compare(Object, Object) will be rejected in the text field, and the increment button will be unable to raise a value beyond this point.

      Passing a null value to this method will remove the maximum value from the spinner.

      Parameters:
      maximumValue - the maximum value allowed by this spinner, or null for no maximum

    • getOnValueChangeListener

      public OnChangeListener<T> getOnValueChangeListener()
      Gets the OnChangeListener currently assigned to this spinner. This method will return null if no listener is set.
      Returns:
      the OnChangeListener assigned to this spinner, or null if there isn't one assigned

    • setOnValueChangeListener

      public void setOnValueChangeListener(OnChangeListener<T> onValueChangeListener)
      Sets the OnChangeListener assigned to this spinner. The listener is called whenever the value for the spinner is updated. It is not called while changes are being made in the text field, but it is called when the field loses focus and the value updates. It is called each time either the increment or decrement buttons are pressed.

      Passing null to this method will remove the OnChangeListener from the spinner.

      Parameters:
      onValueChangeListener - the OnChangeListener that should be called when the value of the spinner changes

    • getPadding

      public Padding getPadding()
      Gets the padding around the buttons and text field for this spinner. This padding is directly applied to the text field used by the spinner, and the buttons are also placed away from the edges of the text box as requested by the padding values.
      Returns:
      The Padding assigned to this spinner

    • setPadding

      public void setPadding(Padding padding)
      Sets the padding around the buttons and text field for this spinner. The padding is directly applied to the text field used by the spinner, and the buttons are also placed away from the edges of the text box as requested by the padding values.

      Passing null to this method will result in the spinner having a padding of 0 in all directions.

      Parameters:
      padding - the Padding to assign to the spinner

    • getUnitsString

      public String getUnitsString()
      Gets the units string assigned to this spinner. The units string is a unit of measurement that is displayed on top of the text field to describe the units of measurement for the value being displayed.
      Returns:
      The units string assigned to this spinner, or null if there isn't one assigned

    • setUnitsString

      public void setUnitsString(String unitsString)
      Sets the units string assigned to this spinner. The units string is a unit of measurement that is displayed on top of the text field to describe the units of measurement for the value being displayed. A null units string will result in no units being displayed.
      Parameters:
      unitsString - the units string to assign to the spinner, or null for no units

    • getValue

      public T getValue()
      Gets the current value from this spinner. This value will always be within the minimum and maximum boundaries set for the spinner (assuming the assigned SpinnerHandler works properly), and it will never be null.
      Returns:
      The current value from this spinner

    • setValue

      public void setValue(T value)
      Sets the current value for this spinner. The value should be within the minimum and maximum values assigned for this spinner, and if it is not, it will be clamped to the closest extreme. It must also not be null, as spinners do not support null values.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to set for this spinner
      Throws:
      UIToolkitException - if the value passed to the method is null

    • getIntegerHandler

      public static SpinnerHandler<Integer> getIntegerHandler()
      Gets the built-in SpinnerHandler for Integer or int values. This handler allows both positive and negative integer values (though this can be limited by setting minimum or maximum values on the spinner itself). The default minimum and maximum values provided by the handler are Integer.MIN_VALUE and Integer.MAX_VALUE respectively. The default value set by the handler if none is provided to the spinner constructor is 0.
      Returns:
      The built-in SpinnerHandler for Integer or int values
